videos.title: Braid Bun Combo | Cute Girls Hairstyles
videos.description:
Check out this darling hairstyle that is a combination of braids, twist, flips, and a bun. Sounds complicated right?  But guess what it really isn't.  Surprisingly this cute hairstyle is simply a creation using four different elements...but all four are SIMPLE hairstyle elements!  

You begin by creating two dutch braids on either side of the middle part line.  Then you take some hair sections and add them to the dutch braids to create a ponytail.  Flipping the ponytail under creates a cute pop to the whole hairstyle and if you pancake the sides it suddenly looks like a boho hairstyle!

After that you simply create two twists and roll them around to form a bun.  It's so easy!

To see your own photo recreations of this style featured in our app, feel free to tag your photos on IG with: #CGHBraidBunCombo

Please be sure to give this video a BIG "👍🏻" if you loved it, and leave a comment below telling us...

videos.title: Side Triple Flower | Cute Girls Hairstyles
videos.description:
Today's video is great as it is a simple and easy hairstyle for beginners.  You can do this easy hairstyle for long hair or as an easy hairstyle for medium hair.  I've used this braided bun hairstyle on myself as an easy DIY hairstyle or on my daughters!  My daughters have even done this hairstyle on each other since it's an easy hairstyle for kids to do!
What makes this hairstyle simple is that you only need to know how to do a regular braid in order to create the great side braid look.  As this hairstyle is so easy, it is also quick which means that you can use this hairstyle as a great go-to for an easy hairstyle for school. 

To begin this hairstyle you need to part off one small section of hair next to the ear.  Then divide this section into three smaller sections.  Pin two of the sections out of the way.  

With the free section of hair, begin a simple braid.  When you have the braid completed gently tug on one side of the braid to pop the edge of the braid outward.  Secure the braid with an elastic leaving the ends in the elastic to create a loop.  Use the loop and begin to roll the braid up into a bun.  

Secure the bun against the head with bobby pins.  Repeat these steps with the other two braids to create a triangle shape of rosette looking buns.  
This easy hairstyle for girls is sure to impress and would love fabulous in so many settings!  Prepare for compliments!  

To see your own photo recreations of this style featured in our app, feel free to tag your photos on IG with: #CGHSideTripleFlower

videos.title: Criss Cross Ponytail Hairstyle | Hairstyles for School
videos.description:
Want a quick and easy hairstyle for school? Today we will teach you how to create this simple Criss Cross Ponytail that you can do in just a few minutes!

Be sure to enter BrooklynAndBailey's GIVEAWAY for a 13" MacBook Air + Wireless Brookstone Movie Projector! Click HERE to enter! https://gleam.io/S9lr0/13-macbook-air-wireless-mobile-projector-giveaway

Need a way to jazz up a simple ponytail, especially for those mornings when you don't have much time before school? This simple hairstyle tutorial will do just that! 

All you need is two small hair elastics and a topsy tail tool (but you can also simply use your fingers to do this). This DIY hairstyle gets easier to do the more you practice, and we are certain that your girl friends will be wondering how you did it!

This hair style is perfect for girls, for teens, and for women of all ages, and would look fabulous dressed up in a fancy dress, or dressed down with a cute t-shirt and jeans. By adding curls as a base, like I did here, you could even wear this for Prom or Homecoming!

To see your own photo recreations of this style featured in our app, feel free to tag your photos on IG with: #CGHCrissCrossPonytail

Kamri volunteered to be my model this week, since she loves half-up hairstyles. Doesn't she look cute?

videos.title: Brooklyn's Double-Bun Half Up Hairstyle & HAIR HACK | Cute Girls Hairstyles Tutorial
videos.description:
Brooklyn teaches us how to create her new easy hairstyle, the Double-Bun Half Up! This is Brooklyn's favorite Cute Girls Hairstyles tutorial that she's ever done. It takes under 3 minutes to recreate, with a very helpful hair hack to make the twists!  Click to watch the video!

Watch Shaun take Paisley on her First Date in our last vlog, HERE!  https://youtu.be/mPYFaclQj6c

We've been showing you messy buns and twisty buns since the very beginning of this channel back in 2009, yet Brooklyn taught me her own twist hack in this video that would have saved me lots of time over the years! You'll love it!

With soft wand curls as the base, you could also use 2nd-day braids to add wave to the hair, or you could simply wear it with straight hair! This hairstyle would be beautiful on any base! This style is quick and easy, and is great for long or medium hair.

To see your own photo recreations of this style featured in our app, feel free to tag your photos on IG with: #CGHDoubleBunHalfUp

Brooklyn also shows us her tip to adding volume above the ears using dry shampoo, so be sure to look for that!

BrooklynAndBailey both use this hair style on mornings when they don't have much time left before school. And we promise your friends will think you spent a long time on it!

As Brooklyn mentioned, please be sure to comment below who from the CGH family you would like to see a DIY hairstyles from next!

💋's -Mindy

Items Needed: Brush, rat-tail comb, spray bottle, hair elastics, 6-10 bobby pins, dry shampoo, and hairspray {if desired}.

Time Requirement: 3-5 minutes

Skill Level: Easy

videos.title: 3 Easy Headband Hairstyles | Cute Girls Hairstyles
videos.description:
I love winter because it makes throwing on a hat or a headband so easy and simple in the mornings.  In this video I will show you three simply and easy hairstyles for wearing headbands.  Pair any of these hairstyles with a cute sweater or jacket and you are ready for the day!

The first headband hairstyle is a darling bun wrapped with a braid.  This easy hairstyle still has a sophisticated look to it that you can wear to work or other dressier events.  

The second headband hairstyle is two stacked fishtails.  I love this style for a soft, boho feel that will work with any soft, knit headband.  If you don't want to stack the braids simply do two fishtails for a similar effect.  

The third hairstyle is a cute sporty pull thru ponytail.  Add a headband and you will be ready for any winter sporting events, a day on the ski slopes, or a fun day out and about.  

To see your own photo recreations of this style featured in our app, feel free to tag your photos on IG with: #CGH3HeadbandStyles

videos.title: How to Create a Barrette Tieback | Hair Tutorials | Cute Girls Hairstyles
videos.description:
For the next style from our hair tutorials, we will teach you how to create a Barrette Tieback using fishtail braids! This is the first time that we've shown you how to accent a braided hairstyle with barrettes (yes, those barrettes from your childhood)! They can make a hairstyle look AWESOME as a teenager or adult! 

To see your own photo recreations of this style featured in our app, feel free to tag your photos on IG with: #CGHBarretteTieback

If you don't know how to Fishtail Braid, watch our tutorial HERE!
https://youtu.be/yL7oUaIW-Dw

Tiebacks are beautiful in half-up, half down hairstyles, but how do you change them up so your hair doesn't always look the same? Today we will be working with a base of subtle curls and then using two fishtail braids that we'll secure in the back with three brass bar barrettes. We'll be securing them in a triangle.

Rylan volunteered for this tutorial, and I am not sure why, but in this video she all of the sudden seemed to have grown up a ton! Like, where did my little RyRy go??? 

Be sure to comment below if you've noticed how fast Rylan is GROWING UP, and also leave me comments for other hairstyles that you would like me to try!

💋's -Mindy

Items Needed: Brush, rat-tail comb, spray bottle, 3 bar barrettes, hairspray {if desired}.

Time Requirement: 5 minutes

Skill Level: Medium

videos.title: Criss-Cross Pigtails | Toddler Hairstyles | Cute Girls Hairstyles
videos.description:
Criss-Cross Applesauce!  I mean Criss-Cross Pigtails!  LOL  If you're a busy Millennial Mom like me you are always looking for easy, tight hairstyles that will work on your toddlers!  This hairstyle is perfect for the mornings you want your daughters to look amazing, but don't want to spend an hour doing their hairstyle.  

In this #CGHCrissCrossPigtails video we take dutch braids and mix them with two pigtails to create an adorable twist to an otherwise boring braided hairstyle.  

This hairstyle is certainly a perfect style for toddlers, but it would also work well as a teen style for girls running off to an athletic class and in need of an athletic hairstyle.  It would also work well for a gym hairstyle, or even dance hairstyle or gymnastics hairstyle.  This is an all around amazing hairstyle!  

We begin by parting the hair in the middle of the head.  Then dividing the hairstyle into four section.  Dutch braid the top two sections closest to the front of the face and then using a regular braid cross it over in the back to the opposite side of head.  Then secure all the hair together creating an X pattern into the two pigtails.

Simply add a few straightener curls to the ends of the pigtails for a little added cuteness and you are ready to go!

To see your own photo recreations of this style featured in our app, feel free to tag your photos on IG with: #CGHCrissCrossPigtails

Please be sure to give this video a BIG "👍🏻" if you loved it, and leave a comment below telling us...

Follow Abby! (Twist Me Pretty)

videos.title: 🦄 Unicorn Half-Up Hairstyle | DIY Halloween Costumes | Cute Girls Hairstyles 🦄
videos.description:
I'm so in love with our Halloween hairstyles so far this year!  But there was something truly magical in the air when we filmed this unicorn hairstyle!  I've always wanted to try unicorn hair after being a little girl and being obsessed with My Little Pony :)  I've been so happy that My Little Pony and unicorns are coming back as current trends! 

To see your own photo recreations of this style featured in our app, feel free to tag your photos on IG with: #CGHUnicornHair

Every year I love Halloween time, and Halloween 2016 is no exception!  There's something about the fall weather, the pumpkins and mums, football, and of course the Halloween costumes and Halloween makeup.  But I'm an especially big fan of creating amazing hairstyles for Halloween to go with our great costumes for Halloween!  Which is why we created this CGH Spooktorials series! 

I know that around this time of year everyone begins looking for hairstyle ideas for Halloween, DIY costumes ideas, last minute costumes, and Halloween makeup ideas.  So I thought I'd make it easy by continuing our Spooktorials and filming some great DIY Halloween videos, DIY costumes, and some great DIY hairstyles.  

Obviously we focus on the hairstyle tutorials on this channel, but you will be able to find lots of great DIYs, costume ideas, and other great Halloween-oriented videos between our channel, the BrooklynAndBailey channel, and the KamriNoel channel.  

But it wasn't till this year that I found the perfect unicorn hairstyle tutorial to teach for all of you!  Out of all my Spooktorials, this one might be my very favorite!  

I begin this Halloween hairstyle (which can easily be done as a DIY hairstyle) by parting her hair down the middle.  I then pulled each side into high ponytails, then divided the ponytail into two sections (one section with about 1/3 of the hair and one section with about 2/3 of the hair).  I straightened the 1/3 section of hair and left it down to fall next to her face and add some softness to her unicorn costume.  With the remaining 2/3 of hair I created a regular braid, pancaked the braid, and twisted it into a bun.  I used bobby pins to secure the braid into a bun.  Then repeated these steps on the other side of the head.  

For added effect with her unicorn look and awesome Halloween costume, I sprayed her hair with silver-colored hair spray and added some glitter to her part line.  Last, but not least, I added a beautiful silver unicorn horn circlet that I found online looking for halloween costume ideas.  

Hope you enjoy this hairstyle for halloween as much as I do! Please be sure to give this video a BIG "👍🏻" if you loved it, and leave a comment below telling us which of all our Spooktorials is your favorite!

💋's -Mindy

Items Needed: Brush, rat-tail comb, spray bottle, bobby pins, small hair elastics, hairspray {if desired}.

Time Requirement: 3-5 minutes

Skill Level: Easy

___

videos.title: How to Create Double Braided Buns | Back-to-School | Cute Girls Hairstyles
videos.description:
Love the braided buns you are seeing around on everyone from Kylie Jenner to Mel B? 

Today we'll teach you exactly how to get the look!The Double Braided Bun Hairstyle is super easy DIY hair buns with braids! In this hair tutorial Brooklyn shows you a quick and easy hairstyle for medium hair, long hair and even some short hair if you do a half up version.  This hairstyle is super easy and perfect for school because it only take seconds to style and can be a last minute hairstyle. These quick hairstyles are also perfect for medium hair, short hair or long hair. 

What I like about this Braided Bun hairstyle is that the buns keep your hair out of your face, which really makes them a perfect hairstyle for school.  But flower buns are even cuter and pretty to look at. We did two braided buns on Brooklyn's hair! 

You can even keep some of the hair accessories for styling your DIY Braided Bun Hairstyle in your locker at school. That way you can easily make a perfect hairstyle when you arrive to school or after PE or after drill team like Brooklyn and Bailey. No need to wake up early just to fix your hair. This hairstyle is very easy and very fashionable at the same time, so get into your hairstyling spirit and let's get started!

Help me translate this DIY Hairstyle:

We've been doing variations of this braided bun hairstyle for years now, but just now getting to it on our list. This is SO super easy, and makes a very cute back-to-school look to go along with a cute pair of jeans and shirt.

Please be sure to give this video a BIG "👍🏻" if you loved it, and leave a comment below telling us when you start back up with school! We start tomorrow morning!

videos.title: Do Hair Tattoos Really Work? | Fab or Fail | Cute Girls Hairstyles
videos.description:
I've wanted to try out these hair tattoos since I first saw them on Kylie Jenner back in October! But, do they really work? Kamri and I decided today to give them the "Fab or Fail" test!

We found our hair tattoos, for a reasonable price, HERE:
Urban Outfitters: http://bit.ly/1TQbsXw
Scunci: http://bit.ly/1OuEQRM
Amazon: http://amzn.to/1qm2TMs

The hair tattoo application process is very similar to a flash tattoo, in fact, they seem nearly identical. I was worried about the tattoo breaking apart when we applied it, but it seemed to hold up well.

After we placed the tattoo where we wanted it, Kamri and I decided to add in a cute tieback to the hair so that the tattoo popped and became more like an accessory.  We both LOVED how it turned out! 

To see your own photo recreations of this style featured in our app, feel free to tag your photos on IG with: #CGHHairTattoos

The final test was to see how easy the tattoos can come out of the hair. Be sure to watch the entire video and see how it went! What do you think?

Please be sure to give this video a BIG "👍🏻" if you loved it, and leave a comment below telling us whether you think Hair Tattoos are Fab or Fail!

Also, don't forget to check out our Behind the Braids vlog series HERE! https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL_SCossQygjuhcUO9Uj6UnOz8nOhHXbp3

💋's -Mindy

videos.title: Bailey's 25mm Wand Curls | Curly Hairstyles
videos.description:
Watch our new music video parody on MillennialMoms! Click HERE and laugh! http://youtu.be/RmPNillSGTI
-

Ever since I had cut my hair to shoulder length, I've been doing these wand curls. So many of you have been asking for a tutorial on how I create them, and they are really easy.

I section off my hair into three layers, bottom, middle, and top, and then use a 25mm curling wand, curling each strand "away" from my face. I hold the hair there for a few seconds, then release the wand and tug the hair strand a bit just to give the curl some length.

To see your own photo recreations of this style featured in our app, feel free to tag your photos on IG with: #CGHWandCurls

Please be sure to give this video a BIG "👍🏻" if you loved it, and leave a comment below telling us if you think Brooklyn should do a DIY hairstyle soon!

Be sure to click the subscribe link above to be notified of each NEW episode! (I am so excited, I can hardly stand it!)

videos.title: Dad Teaches How to Create Pippi Longstocking Braids
videos.description:
Today's tutorial is another Daddy Do, done by Shaun! He will be continuing our Halloween Spooktorial series by teaching how to create Pippi Longstocking Braids! 

Watch our Rylan and the girls meet Taylor Swift HERE!
http://youtu.be/FMfQl_qjGPw

We've done these braids for years, and Shaun is always the one to get involved on these more decorative and wild hairstyles. He uses 16 gauge wire, bent in half and twisted. Why not use a wire clothes hanger? Because the girls say that hanger wire hurts their heads, so Shaun uses a thinner wire that he then twists up {twisting helps grip the braids better for less slide} and doesn't hurt their heads.

We call this a Daddy Do for two reasons, first, because you are using two simple 3-strand braids, anyone can do them... even dads! The second reason is that they get to use man tools to do the hair!  LOL!

To see your own photo recreations of this style featured in our app, feel free to tag your photos on IG with: #CGHPippiBraids

I was literally laughing off camera when Shaun says "... this is part of our Spooktorial series, and this hairstyle is a little scary!" I love that he is willing to do things like this when most men won't! The kids mean everything to him!

Hope you love our #CGHSpooktorials series! Please be sure to give this video a BIG "👍🏻" if you loved it, and please do leave a comment below telling us how well you thought Shaun {and Kamri} did!

💋's -Mindy
 

Items Needed: 16 gauge crafting wire, screwdriver, wire cutters, brush, rat-tail comb, spray bottle, 2 hair elastics, hairspray {if desired}.

Time Requirement: 5 minutes

Skill Level: Easy

videos.description:
Need a hairstyle idea to go with your costume? Today we teach you the Twist Faux Braid, a perfect hairstyle for a Greek or Roman Goddess! Be sure to check out the rest of our Halloween Spooktorials HERE! 
http://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL_SCossQygjtjdIDFVDBGJDzDn_f5uS-c
__

It's almost Halloween, and we are ready to give you a few more Spooktorials! This one was requested by Brooklyn, also my model, who wanted a hairstyle to match her Grecian Goddess dress and cape.

We took a style we've shown you before, the Faux French Braid, and twisted it up "literally" after being inspired by SecretosDeChicas on IG! 

We began with a simple 3-strand braid down the middle and threaded through loose twists of hair, intermixed clockwise and counter-clockwise, from the sides of the head. What this leaves you with is a very full and beautiful faux braid that would be perfect for a Greek \ Roman Goddess or princess costume.

To see your own photo recreations of this style featured in our app, feel free to tag your photos on IG with: #CGHTwistFaux Braid

Please be sure to give this video a BIG "👍🏻" if you loved it, and leave a comment below telling us which of our #CGHSpooktorials has been your favorite so far!

videos.title: No-Heat Plopping Curls | Back-to-School Hairstyles
videos.description:
It has been a few months since our last no-heat curls tutorial, so we wanted to show you another one today that is perfect for Back to School!

These are called Plopping Curls {or Plunking Curls}, obviously because you plop your hair into a t-shirt, and then tie them up. I use a little product to help define the curls as they dry, so be sure to watch the video to get the full process.

To see your own photo recreations of this style featured in our app, feel free to tag your photos on IG with: #CGHPloppingCurls

What I love about no-heat curl tutorials is that you are using absolutely zero heat in creating them. For this tutorial, it is a t-shirt creating the curls.

Be sure to start with your hair slightly more than damp, not "dripping" wet. If the hair is too wet, your curls will not turn out. As a reference point, be sure to notice how wet my hair is when I begin the plopping.

Please be sure to give this video a BIG "👍🏻" if you loved it, and leave a comment below telling us what hairstyle we should do next!

💋's -Mindy
 

Items Needed: Damp hair, curl defining mousse, 1 t-shirt, dry shampoo, if desired.

Time Requirement: 2 minutes plopping & styling {not including overnight drying}

Skill Level: Easy

videos.description:
Click HERE to watch BrooklynAndBailey's "Parent Trap Parody" & "Prom Dress Gone Wrong" comedy collab with StudioC! http://youtu.be/unFAHooh_zE?list=UU6QWhGQqf0YDYdRb0n6ojWw

This braided hairstyle is inspired by the rick rack ribbon used in both the sewing and quilting worlds. {We've shown you this technique a long time ago, in our Textured Braids tutorial back in 2013... http://youtu.be/EVX_7Qq_y6s}

Rick Rack is literally defined by Webster's Dictionary as "a flat braid to form zigzags and used especially as trimming on clothing." 

Our tutorial today uses the Rick Rack braid as a simple pinback with Kamri's straight hair. Although the braid looks fairly complex, it really is one of the easiest to create. If you know how to braid a simple 3-strand braid, then this one is going to be easy for you!

To see your own photo recreations of this hairstyle featured in our app, feel free to tag your photos on IG with: #CGHRickRackBraid

We use this braid as an accent, simply because it has so much already going on with it. This braid could also be cute as a tieback.

videos.description:

http://www.instagram.com/cutegirlshairstyles
__________

To see your own photo recreations of this style featured in our app, feel free to tag your photos on IG with: #CGHFauxFrench

I recently learned this Faux French Braid from a friend, whose 10-yr old daughter was wearing it that day. It looked like a French Braid to me, but I could tell that it really wasn't by the "slightly off" stitching pattern. When I finally saw how she braided it, we fell in love with it!

When Brooklyn and I were done filming, it all of the sudden hit me that this could have been a "Daddy 'Do" hairstyle. It's that easy to do! We didn't have time to re-film it with Shaun as the stylist, but he says that he thinks he could do it much easier compared to a French braid.

Please be sure to give this video a BIG "👍" if you loved it, and leave a comment below telling us how many days of school you have left!

We've shown you a few faux braids over the past few years, but the French Braid really is a stumbling block for many beginning braiders. But, given its slightly different look, learning this French braid hack can be very useful for anyone at any age!

videos.title: Rope Twisted Bun | Cute Prom Hairstyles
videos.description:
You can follow Kamri's Instagram account by clicking below!
http://www.instagram.com/kamrinoel

Today's hairstyle tutorial is part of our Prom series, where we show you cute hairstyles you can wear to your Prom, Homecoming, or other event. The twins were in LA this week, so Kamri offered to sit in.

To see your own photo recreations of this style featured in our app, feel free to tag your photos on IG with: #CGHRopeTwistBun

Rope twists are the easiest braids to create. This undo uses two rope twists that are then wrapped around each other and secured into a high bun. By fluffing the rope twists and leaving out a few curly strands/tendrils in the front by the face, this becomes the perfect Prom hairstyle!

For athletic events, all you have to to twist your rope twists tightly, adding pomade or hairspray to them, and then wrapping them tightly into a bun and securing them. {For sports, or ballet, do not fluff the rope braids as I did in the video... keep them tight.}

Please be sure to give this video a BIG "👍" if you loved it, and leave a comment below telling us if you would like to see more Prom hairstyles!

*Inspired by TheBeautyDepartment.

videos.title: Boxer Braid No-Heat Curls | Cute Girls Hairstyles
videos.description:
To try out the product I used in this video, please click HERE:
Suave Professionals Luxe Style Infusion Curl Defining Gel Serum – http://amzn.to/1TQmlsk

It's time for another no-heat curls tutorial! Today, we're happy to take part in Suave Professionals’ “Style It Yourself” program by teaching you how to get salon-quality curls at home using no heat! As a result, this tutorial will appear on Pinterest.com/SuaveBeauty!

This method is perfect if you are off to the gym in the morning, or running errands during the day, but have an event that you need to attend later that night. Two looks in one, which gives you a tight hairstyle for when you're active, and beautiful curls later on. I also use this method for overnight curls.

To see your own photo recreations of this style featured in our app, feel free to tag your photos on IG with: #CGHBoxerBraidCurls & #StyleItYourself

To get the look, all you need is damp hair, curl-defining serum gel, and Boxer Braids. The product helps condition my hair as a serum would, and also help define the curls like a gel would, but doesn't leave the hair feeling "crunchy" or stiff when I am done.

The Boxer Braid No-Heat Curls form in 3 Easy Steps:

1. Begin with damp hair, and add in the curl defining serum gel.
2. Create Boxer Braids {Double French Braids into a single braid} and allow to dry.
3. Remove the braids, finger comb the curls, and set your part line.

What I really love is that you can use these curls as a base for any number of hairstyle combinations {updos, buns, twists, French braids, Dutch braids, fishtail braids, pancake braids, accent braids, side braids, etc}. 

Please don’t forget to give this video a huge “Thumbs Up”, and leave a comment below if you would like to see more curly hair tutorials!

💋's -Mindy
 

Items Needed: Rat-tail comb, spray bottle, 1 hair elastic, Suave Professionals Luxe Style Infusion Curl Defining Gel Serum, hairspray {optional}, silk scarf {optional to cover the hair if sleeping the the braids overnight}.

Time Requirement: 7-10 minutes

Skill Level: Easy

To see step-by-step instructions and more photos of this style, please visit... http://www.cutegirlshairstyles.com/?p=8483

videos.title: Messy Split Fishtail Braid | Cute Braids
videos.description:
Click here to see BrooklynAndBailey's Bonus Video from Friday! 
http://youtu.be/wnjQ_mdTPlU
______

This has to be one of the most beautiful fishtail braid hairstyles ever! I have been receiving requests on FB, Twitter, email, etc, for today's hairstyle from viewers everywhere. It has been likely our most requested hairstyle to date! You can understand why if you've seen many photos of this style floating around on Pinterest, Facebook, and Instagram.

There is nothing super new or special about the Split Fishtail, as the braid itself is exactly the same as our Box Fishtail from last year. It's the braiding technique you use, however, that's different. 

For a cute final look, simply pancake only the underside and you'll end up with a very beautiful braid look similar to our Stacked Braid tutorial from a few years back! This one has much more of a messy look to it, which I love!

To see your own photo recreations featured in our app, feel free to tag your own photos of this hairstyle on IG with: #CGHMessySplitFishtail

As always, any fishtail braid will take you a while to complete. This one not super difficult, which is why we are categorizing it as "Easy", but do plan on spending about 8-10 minutes on the braid.

Enjoy!

Sony Pictures' remake of Annie is set to release in theaters on Dec 19th! Annie has always been a family favorite in our home, and I absolutely LOVE the character of Miss Hannigan, played by Carol Burnett, from the original movie! Now that we have adopted Daxton & Paisley, the movie "Annie" means even that much more to us since the theme is about adoption!

videos.description:

____________________

This week's hairstyle is inspired by Prim in the new Mockingjay movie of The Hunger Games movie franchise. We've watched Prim grow up, from a little girl with side braids into a beautiful young woman who works to take care of injured patients in a hospital.

Prim's braided hairstyles have matured right along with her, as we see in this tutorial. 

We know that Prim needs her hair out of her face, and pinned back out of the way, so that she can care for her patients. The best way to do this would be with an updo!, And, typical to Prim's affinity for signature braids, just like Katniss, she keeps braids as the base for her updo. 

This is a very easy updo to create, and it gives a very sophisticated look especially when worn slicked back. I can see this hairstyle being perfect for formal occasions, cheer, dance, ballet, and some sports.

To see your own photo recreations featured in our app, feel free to tag your own photos of this hairstyle on IG with: #CGHPrimBuns

Have you guys seen the movie yet? What did you think of it? Please leave a comment below!

We wanted to give you another short hairstyle tutorial, showing how to create Double-Flip Accents that can be used in any number of hairstyle combos.

We've been doing these for years, particularly across the front of the head as a way to keep bangs/fringe out of your eyes. You can also do them straight down the back of the head, or any other cool and cute combo.

Congrats to Serena Zags, from the US, for winning our Frendz "Taylor" Headphones Giveaway!  

My girls have worn this Chain Link Braid off and on for several years now, however our updated version, with a new twist technique, in a combo, has become a personal favorite of Brooklyn & Bailey recently. {Our older, less tight version is called the Triple Twist Ponytail http://youtu.be/4uYcbea_8vo from back in July 2010.}

videos.title: Mermaid Half Braid Tutorial | Cute Hairstyles
videos.description:
Be sure to Like us on Facebook! http://www.facebook.com/CuteGirlsHairstyles

* ~ * ~ * ~ * ~ * ~ *

The contest has ended, and prize awarded. Our Waterfall Twists into Mermaid Braid {http://youtu.be/Gc7p8IVVzbM} did so well back in May 2013, that we decided go for another mermaid braid look today!

This one is a half-up-half-down hairstyle with gorgeous definition in its stranding! A Mermaid Braid works just the same as a Lace Braid, however you are adding strands in on "both" sides of the braid, instead of just one. {You can think of it as an extremely fine stranded, but loose French Braid.}

I wouldn't recommend this style for anyone being very "active" throughout the day, such as PE, dance, or other athletics. This would be worn more for casual wear. Trust us, we have tried!

If you want to see your recreation photos featured in our CGH App, please feel free to tag your own photos of this hairstyle with: #CGHMermaidHalfBraid

You can carry the mermaid stranding all the way down the braid, if you would like, but we stopped half way because we loved the look! It is just a matter of personal preference.

Kamri has worn this Mermaid Half Braid a few times over the past several months, and her friends absolutely love it! She even said that a few boys commented on it, which is a huge shocker coming from boys her age!

* ~ * ~ * ~ * ~ * ~ *

For the giveaway, there is a total of 18 entries possible {however only 1 is required, and it's easy peasy}! If you complete the first one, the widget unlocks several other ways to gain bonus entries for a better chance to win!

The contest begins today and ends on Saturday, Sept 13th at 11:59pm CST. This is open internationally, and you must be age 18 or older to enter. If you are younger than that, a parent must enter. The widget picks the winner at random, on its own, we have no say at all. The widget will also ask for a valid email address, which is necessary for us email you should you win.  The email is for winner notification purposes only, and will be deleted when the contest is over. The winner then has 24 hours to claim the gift, or another winner will be drawn. YouTube as a company is neither a sponsor of, nor affiliated with, this giveaway.

This isn't a sponsored post, and the gift item was purchased by me for the sole purpose of rewarding our viewers! Thanks to you all for being with us each week, and good luck in the giveaway!

💋's to you all!

-Mindy

videos.title: How to Create "No-Heat" Paper Towel Curls
videos.description:
Want to see an adorable interview of Sweet Pea on BrooklynAndBailey's channel? Click here: http://youtu.be/h0tC1cGMMXw

* ~ * ~ * ~ * ~ * 

You all know that we love posting no-heat curls tutorials from time to time! This one is inspired by a rag curls technique our grandmothers may have used when they were young. My own grandmother used to do them!

Rather than used a cut up t-shirt, we decided to use something just as effective, but something you would definitely have around the house... paper towels!

Feel free to tag your own photos of this hairstyle with: #CGHPaperTowelCurls

These work nicely, because they wick excess moisture from the hair to help hold the curl. My girls wear them to sleep, but for this video we filmed the before and after the same day, after about 5-6 hours at home. {If you want to expedite the process, you can choose a hairdryer on low heat.}

These curls are beautiful and voluminous. They are perfect as is, or as a base for a hairstyle combination with braids, buns, twist backs, etc. You can also get about 2-3 days worth of curls/waves by doing this!

Enjoy!

xoxo
Mindy


Items Needed: Brush, rat-tail comb, spray bottle, 1 roll of paper towels, hairspray and accessory {if desired}.

Skill Level: Easy

We hope to see as many of you from Singapore as possible, so please bring your friends... and meet some new ones! We will be giving away an autographed CGH t-shirt to the first 20 people there!

http://www.cutegirlshairstyles.com/?p=7094

Our No-Heat Curl video series {see them all here... http://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PL87EDA0AD6AAC4046} is very popular, and it's about time that we posted another no-heat tutorial!

This one uses nothing but a few bandanas/handkerchiefs, a few rubber bands, and a water spray bottle. This technique gives you more of a wave than a full curl, and it dries fairly well because the bandanas breathe by allowing moisture to evaporate as you sleep.

You can use these curls/waves as is, or you can incorporate them as a base for any number of hairstyle combos.  In this tutorial, Brooklyn simply added a simple headband as an accessory.

This is so easy, we know you all can do this! Enjoy!

Items Needed: Brush, spray bottle, 3-5 small hair elastics, hairspray and accessory {if desired}.

videos.description:
Tweet with us! http://www.twitter.com/CuteGirlHair

* ~ * ~ * ~ * ~ *

Tag your own photos of this hairstyle with: #CGHSidesUpSlideUp

One of the first tutorials we ever posted on our website nearly 5 years ago, was a Slide-Up Braid {aka Snake Braid} http://youtu.be/s2n5XkFh88A. That video has over 6,000,000 views today!
 
We have done a few variations of the Slide-Up Braid over the years, but this is a beautiful one because it is so subtle.  The purpose of a Sides Up style is to pull back your sides with another hairstyling accent and feature your natural or curly hair.  This style does just that.

By creating Slide-Up Braids on either side of the head, and pinning them back while covering the pins with your down hair, you are left with such a beautiful hairstyle!

Bailey wore this hairdo to her Christmas concert yesterday and received lots of compliments on it.  We are certain you will too, when you wear this!

Enjoy!

Items Needed: Brush, rat-tail comb, spray bottle, 2 small hair elastics, 4-6 small bobby pins, hairspray {if desired}.

Many of you have been asking how I have achieved the waves worn in my past several videos. Today is the day that I teach you!  I do it with a Deep V Waver.

It is important to first spritz your hair with a heat protectant, and to always know never to use too much heat.  When I crimp, you will notice that I never hold it more than 2-3 seconds.

Pay attention to how I wave the top, because my trick will leave your hair looking even better!

videos.title: ❀ Headband Twist | Half-Up Half-Down Hairstyles ❀
videos.description:
We want to see your re-created photos! Be sure to tag your own photo with #CGHHeadbandTwist on Instagram and Twitter this week, and we may repost yours!

* ~ * ~ * ~ * ~ * ~ *

Several months ago Brooklyn was wearing a headband we bought from Target, one that was braided in the front but with an elastic on the back half.  She didn't like that you could see that elastic from behind, so Bailey twisted hair around the back half of the headband and it looked super cute!

This isn't actually a new technique, as we showed you two years ago how to do this to create headband curls, as seen here: http://youtu.be/0Rdfgu3zqY4  

Instead, on this headband twist version, you have a half-up half-down hairstyle that is sooo pretty!

Plus, I show you a trick on how to get the headband to stay where you want it, using pre-set bobby pins.

Bailey used a NuMe 19mm wand to create her base curls, but the hairstyle will look equally as great on straight hair with subtle waves! Try out the hairstyle, and let us know what you think!  This one is so easy!

Enjoy!

Items Needed: Curling wand, rat-tail comb, brush, 1 braided headband {elastic back}, 2 bobby pins, hairspray {if desired}.

Time Requirement: 3-4 minutes

Skill Level: Easy

To see step-by-step instructions and more photos of this style, please visit...

videos.title: Lace-Up Braid | Cute Braided Hairstyles
videos.description:
Did you know you can follow us on Instagram? We will see you there! http://www.instagram.com/CuteGirlsHairstyles

* ~ * ~ * ~ * ~ * ~ * ~ * ~ *

Tag your own photos of this hairstyle with: #CGHLaceUpBraid

For this week's tutorial, we wanted to show you how to lace two simple braids together.  Why do we like this?  

Because some girls can spend 20+ minutes trying to get a 6-strand braid.  Using our cheat method here, you can get a similar look in only a few minutes!

Literally, you create two simple braids and then use one previously-excluded free strand to lace them together... just like lacing up boots!  Once you get the lacing down, you can tie together a 4+ strand braid, or any number of individual braids!

Try it and see how many comments you get!  When you tell your friends it only took just a few minutes, they won't believe you!

Feel free, if you liked this particular Lace Up Braid tutorial, to share it with two friends who you think will love it, too!  Thanks in advance!

xoxo

Items Needed: Brush, rat-tail comb, spray bottle, 2 hair bands, 1 small hair elastic, and hairspray {if desired}.

Time Requirement: 3-5 minutes

Skill Level: Easy

videos.title: Lace Braid Twists into Ponytail | Cute Girls Hairstyles
videos.description:
Be sure watch our 2nd video for tonight, Recreate Merida's Fiery and Curly Red Hair, over on Disney's Style channel... http://youtu.be/_wF2rYDPWAE

* ~ * ~ * ~ * ~ * ~ * ~ * 

Tag your own photos of this hairstyle with: #CGHLaceBraidPony

We wanted to show you a cute ponytail idea this week, using Lace Braids in a different way!

This one is like braiding a one-sided French Braid, so if you know how to create a French Braid, this one will be cinch!  At the end of each Lace braid, I twisted in the remaining hair into the resulting strand, and repeated the same on the other side!

After creating the Lace Braid Twists on both sides, I then combined them into a ponytail in the back and accented it with a lace clip-in bow.  You can leave the ponytail as is, add curls to it, or any other ponytail combo you can come up with!

Enjoy!

Items Needed: Brush, rat-tail comb, spray bottle, 1 hair band, hair accessory and hairspray {if desired}.

Time Requirement: 5 minutes

Skill Level: Medium

videos.description:
Today's video features CGH#1 filming her very first tutorial!  She wanted to show all of you an easy hairstyle she does on herself in the mornings in "2 minutes or less".

This is called a Faux {Fake} Fishtail, and CGH#1 loves it because it looks like a fishtail braid... but you did not have to spend 20 minutes braiding it! 

Feel free to tag your own photos of this hairstyle with: #CGHFauxFishtailBraid

We have done triple and quadruple-flipped ponytails before, but they used several elastics.  This flipping technique is so cool, that you literally only need one elastic!  

Also, we present to you our four favorite names for our new family puppy... from the over 16,000 fan suggestions you left in our last video.  Our four favorites are Chewy {from Chewbacca in Star Wars}, Thor {because this little guy is so tough}, Mousse {play on words for a tough Moose and the mousse foam used in hair, and Braidy {play on words for Brady, the boy's name, and "Braid"y, since we are huge fans of braids!  

For the next week, are allowing our fans to vote for their favorite from among those four names, and we will announce the new puppy's name in our net video!  Be sure to comment below with your vote!

Enjoy!

* ~ * ~ * ~ * ~ *

Fans absolutely love our No-Heat Curl series, and this is Bantu Knot version is one we in our home have been enjoying for many years now!  {This knot technique is of African origin and has been by African women and girls for generations.}

Feel free to tag your own photos of this hairstyle with: #CGHBantuKnotCurls

Bantu knots are fabulous to use in combo hairstyles!  In fact, you can see other styles in which we have used the Bantu Knots here...

Star Twists:   http://youtu.be/NrN2LKuFc-A 
The Bun Hawk:   http://youtu.be/qfWHYOjpCR4  

Each of these Bantu Knot styles leaves gorgeous curls for the next day when you untwist the knots!  The curls can last you up to 3-4 days!  I find that you really do not have to keep them in all night to achieve great curls... as you get better creating the knots, you can leave them in for only 3-4 hours and receive a great result.  

{Most Common Overlooked Mistake:  Be sure that you only dampen the hair before twisting the knots... if the hair is too wet, the hair will fall limp when you take our the knots!}

Items Needed:  Brush, Rat-tail comb, 10 hair elastics, hairspray and accessory {if desired}.

Time Requirement:  5-7 minutes to create knots, sleep overnight, 5-7 minutes to remove twists and style hair.

As everyone knows, the Waterfall Braid is so popular right now but many who do not know how to French Braid have a difficult time creating it.  A friend of mine, Kori at {http://www.youtube.com/hair4myprincess} was the first to come up with this waterfall braid cheat and we wanted to share it with you as well!

Feel free to tag your own photos of this hairstyle with: #CGHWaterfallTwist

Items Needed:  Brush or rat-tail comb, 1 bobby pin, hairspray {if desired}.

Time Requirement:  5  minutes

Steps:

1.  Start on front right of the head and section out a large strand of hair that can be your base for the twist around the head.
2.  Divide this strand in two equal pieces and twist them around each other once.
3.  Take a new selected strand of hair and place it between your twisting strands, so that it literally falls through.
4.  Twist the two original strands once more.
5.  Repeat steps 3 and 4 all the way around the back of the head and towards the top of the left ear.
6.  When you finish your last twist, grab a bobby pin and secure the end of the twist above the ear, making sure to hide the bobby pin as best as you can.
7.  Use hairspray {if desired} to help control flyaways.

Enjoy!

Watch for us on the Anderson Cooper daytime talk show on March 5th, 2012!  Visit http://www.andersoncooper.com/ and enter your zip code to see on what channel it airs in our area!  

The episode summary can also be viewed here...
http://www.andersoncooper.com/episodes/easy-money-hour/

A special thanks to Anderson Cooper and his wonderful staff for including us in the show, and for making our stay in NYC amazing!  Everyone was so great to work with!  Also, we want to thank Abbi Tatton and the YouTube PR Team for helping arrange all this!

After filming, Anderson stopped by the Green Room to visit with the girls.  Our #4 was in a particularly "slap-happy" mood and was having fun teasing Anderson.  I quickly grabbed my iPhone and caught the tail end as she told Anderson that he should get a mohawk!

Luckily for us, we had just filmed this Bun Hawk hairstyle a week ago, so Anderson... this one is for you!!!

Feel free to tag your own photos of this hairstyle with: #CGHBunHawk

Items Needed: Brush, rat-tail comb, spray bottle, 10 hair bands, hairspray {if desired}.

Time Requirement: 10+ minutes

Steps:

1. Start with wet, brushed hair...

2. Make five ponytails down the center of the head, starting with a section in front and work your way back, secure them with bands. {Make sure that the hair in the ponytails are as equal as possible, so that the buns are relatively the same size.}

3. Take the first ponytail and being twisting the hair strand until it wants to twist around itself, gently allowing it to twist around the ponytail holder into a bun, and secure with another hairband.

4. Repeat Step 3 for the other four ponytails.

5. Lightly spritz hairspray to help secure any flyways.

{If you have problems with thin hair or baby flyways, you may want to try a little pomade or hair fiber gum to help hold in the twisty buns, but this is completely optional.}

Find many more hairstyles by visiting our website:
http://www.cutegirlshairstyles.com

If you are like me you've noticed that everyone on TV, movies, magazines, or the internet are talking about the comeback of braids.  Everyone is wearing them and there are a million ways to wear them.

Feel free to tag your own photos of this hairstyle with: #CGHMessySideBraid

One of my very favorite braid hairstyles, is a small added flair to a simple braid... what everyone is calling a simple Messy Braid.  This is the perfect second day hairstyle {after curls the day prior} for a quick rush out the door.  

I've received so many emails asking for this tutorial.  I even had one fan ask over 10 friends to all email within a few hours each asking for this style!  Now, that is determination!  It definitely got my attention and I decided to make this our next tutorial.  

Items Needed: Brush, comb, ponytail holder, hairspray {if desired}

Time required: 2 minutes

Steps:
1.  Begin with dry slightly messy or curly hair.  {You can use a flat iron or wand to add a little curl to the top layer if needed}.  
2.  Pull all hair loosely to one side over your shoulder.
3.  Braid the hair using the regular braiding method.
4.  Tug on the elbows of the braid to loosen/flatten and soften the braid.
5.  Curl any loose pieces of hair to frame your face.  Remember it's supposed to be MESSY!  
6.  Bobby pin any problem strands into place.

Hope you enjoy!

We added a little flair in our Sock Curls Hairstyle tutorial a few weeks ago, and so many of you fans noticed and subsequently requested that we show you what we did!  Fortunately, we actually filmed these Bohemian "Pancake" Braids that very same day, so here you go!

We used the Sock Curls as the base for this hairstyle, or you can use the Headband Curls as well, but if you have not seen how to create those gorgeous "no-heat" curls, you can see it here... http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CzJKdHglFck

Now, this braiding technique is so simple and we call the resulting braids are "Pancake Braids".  My girls gave the name simply because the braids are flat like pancakes {kids are creative!}.  So, you have my girls to thank for the name!  You just create a normal 3-strand braid, braided loosely, and then go back and tug out the elbows in the braid {which flattens the braid} before securing with an elastic.

Feel free to tag your own photos of this hairstyle with: #CGHPancakeBraids

In this hairstyle, we did two pancake braids from the front/sides and then brought them back and pinned them up to create this beautiful Bohemian look.  I promise you will get compliments on this hairstyle!

Enjoy!

We have had lots of fun lately trying out several curling options that use absolutely no heat!  Many of you have already seen our tutorial for "No-Heat Headband Curls here... http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0Rdfgu3zqY4

Instead of using a headband on this one, we used simple socks!  This is super easy to do, and the curls last a long time. I also like pin curls or rag/paper bag curls but they can take up to 20-30 minutes or more to put in.  This takes literally 2 minutes to put in, and you can style the hairdo the next day in any number of combinations!

I tied in the socks lower, because we are totally into the low curls lately... but you could roll them all the way up for more volumous curls up top.

Feel free to tag your own photos of this hairstyle with: #CGHSockCurls

It is key to make sure that the hair is slightly damp {not wet} anytime you want no-heat curls. If the hair is too wet, it will not hold the curl as well.

Aren't these ho-heat curl hairstyles so fun?  Enjoy!

PLEASE WATCH FOR US ON ABCNEWS' 20/20 YOUTUBE SPECIAL THIS COMING FRIDAY {SEPT 23, 2011 @ 10PM EST}!!!  We are super excited!  Feel free to share with your friends!

If you want to do a HUGE favor for us, If any of you plan on tweeting during the program, as I will, please use the following hashtags... #CuteGirlsHairstyles, #GenerationYouTube and feel free to mention @YouTube, @ABC2020, and us @CuteGirlHair! Thanks a million!

Feel free to tag your own photos of this hairstyle with: #CGHTripleTwistPin

This is a twist style that I have been wearing a lot over the past year or so, and it really is easy to do once you have the hang of it  It is a quick updo that takes literally 5 minutes or so!

You simply have your hair down, then sectioning it out into three even sections {without parting}.  Then twist each strand until it coils upon itself and then bobby pin it firmly.  Do this to the remaining two sections for a hairstyle that is sure to get compliments.

If accessorized appropriately, this would be a great prom or homecoming hairstyle, or a great flower girls style as well!  Enjoy!
